733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f119b2f46a.name: Lewis Hamilton
733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f119b2f46a.description: Seven-time World Drivers' Champion Lewis Hamilton enters 2021 with his sights set on adding a record-breaking eighth title to his collection. The Briton has dominated Formula 1 in recent years thanks to a Mercedes team that’s been a class above the rest of the pack.

733fa9a1-26b6-499d-b299-21f119b2f46a.name: Valtteri Bottas
733fa9a1-26b6-499d-b299-21f119b2f46a.description: Finnish Formula 1 driver Valterri Bottas will hope to put a disappointing 2020 campaign behind him and mount a serious title challenge in what will be his fifth season at Mercedes. Since joining the German giants in 2017, Bottas has performed solidly but has been overshadowed by his record-breaking teammate, Lewis Hamilton.

34a1cab1-81f1-47e5-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.name: Max Verstappen
34a1cab1-81f1-47e5-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.description: A generational talent, Max Verstappen enters the 2021 season after finishing third in the Drivers' standings. Having already broken a series of records in the sport, the World Championship remains elusive to the Dutchman given the dominance of Mercedes and Lewis Hamilton.

34a1cab1-81f1-47e5-aec3-ab6c9810ert2.name: Sergio Perez
34a1cab1-81f1-47e5-aec3-ab6c9810ert2.description: It was a whirlwind 2020 for Sergio Perez. Not only did the Mexican contract coronavirus, but he spent the latter part of the season contemplating his potential exit from the sport after losing his seat to Sebastian Vettel for 2021. However, a career-best fourth-place finish in the Drivers’Championship – which included his first Grand Prix victory – saw him earn a move to Red Bull

733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f120b2f53a.name: Lando Norris
733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f120b2f53a.description: Thanks to viral overtakes, last lap heroics and an internet army behind him, McLaren driver Lando Norris can look back on 2020 as the year he showed his true potential in Formula 1, despite finishing behind departing teammate Carlos Sainz in the standings.

733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-33f120b2f53a.name: Daniel Ricciardo
733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-33f120b2f53a.description: After two seasons with French giant Renault ended on a high note with podiums and promises of memorable tattoos, Australian 'Honey Badger' Daniel Ricciardo heads into 2021 with a new drive at McLaren as the team look to reach the front of the grid.

dc888r1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.name: Sebastian Vettel
dc888r1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.description: Formula 1's fourth most successful driver in terms of titles, Sebastian Vettel entered the 2021 campaign with Aston Martin Racing, marking a new chapter in his career after six seasons at Ferrari.

dc888r1a-397f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.name: Lance Stroll
dc888r1a-397f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.description: Lance Stroll headed into 2021 at the revamped Aston Martin team on the back of a topsy-turvy 2020 that peaked with a pair of podiums and a first-ever pole position. However, the young Canadian will need to work on his consistency, with four-time World Champion Sebastian Vettel taking over as his teammate.

23a1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.name: Fernando Alonso
23a1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.description: After two years out of the sport, Fernando Alonso returns to Formula 1 with Alpine – formerly Renault – for 2021. The two-time World Champion is widely regarded as one of the most complete drivers in the world, and the French team will be hoping his experience helps push them further up the grid after a fifth-place classification in 2020.

29c1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.name: Esteban Ocon
29c1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.description: After a tricky 2020, Esteban Ocon will look forward to 2021 with renewed optimism after finishing last season on a high. The Frenchman was outperformed by Daniel Ricciardo but will hope the experience stands him in good stead as he prepares to square-off against the returning Fernando Alonso.

dc888b1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.name: Charles Leclerc
dc888b1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966feb8.description: Ferrari's great hope, Charles Leclerc is seen as the best bet to bring the team back to the forefront of motorsport. After a successful maiden campaign, the young Monegasque had a trying 2020 season, with the Italian outfit failing to provide either of their drivers with competitive machinery.

dc888b1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966mar8.name: Carlos Sainz
dc888b1a-400f-47f3-9619-07607966mar8.description: Carlos Sainz will swap orange for red in 2021 as he looks to help Ferrari bounce back from a torrid 2020 season. The Spaniard has become a well-rounded driver and enjoyed two successful years with McLaren, which culminated in the Woking-based outfit securing third in the Constructors' Championship.

34a1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.name: Pierre Gasly
34a1cab1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.description: A reinvigorated Pierre Gasly will look to build on his momentous 2020 season as AlphaTauri’s lead driver. After facing questions about his future in the sport, Gasly silenced his doubters in 2020 with some phenomenal performances, the most notably of course being his win at the Italian Grand Prix.

34a1drb1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.name: Yuki Tsunoda
34a1drb1-81f1-47a8-aec3-ab6c9810efe1.description: Yuki Tsunoda will make his Formula 1 debut for the AlphaTauri team in 2021. The Red Bull and Honda junior driver finished third in the F2 Championship in 2020, earning himself a promotion into F1. At AlphaTauri, the Japanese rookie will line up alongside Frenchman Pierre Gasly

733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f119b2f53a.name: Kimi Raikkonen
733fa9a1-26b6-490d-b299-21f119b2f53a.description: At 41-years-old, Kimi Raikkonen is the elder statesman of Formula 1 having made his debut back in 2001. To put that into context, Yuki Tsunoda - who debuts for AlphaTauri this year - was less than a year old when the Finn made his first F1 appearance.

733fa9a1-17e6-490d-b299-21f119b2f53a.name: Antonio Giovinazzi
733fa9a1-17e6-490d-b299-21f119b2f53a.description: The Italian will be hoping he can improve on the four points scored in 2020 after both he and teammate Kimi Raikkonen were hampered by a car that lacked the performance of its 2019 predecessor. With an ever-growing pool of young racers waiting in the wings, his third full season in Formula 1 could be make or break.

733fa9a1-17e6-543l-b299-21f119b2f53a.name: Mick Schumacher
733fa9a1-17e6-543l-b299-21f119b2f53a.description: After winning the FIA Formula 2 Championship, Mick Schumacher will now make his Formula 1 debut with the Haas F1 Team. With a surname synonymous with motor racing, all eyes will be on young Schumacher as he seeks to leave his own legacy on the sport.

733fa9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-21f119b2f53a.name: Nikita Mazepin
733fa9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-21f119b2f53a.description: After a disappointing 2020 season that saw Haas F1 Racing register just three points, an all new driver line-up sees Mick Schumacher and Nikita Mazepin make the step up from Formula 2. The pressure will be on the Russian to perform immediately given the names the American team passed on to bring him into the fold.

kn45a9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-21f119b2f53a.name: George Russell
kn45a9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-21f119b2f53a.description: An exciting prospect for the future, Mercedes Junior, George Russell will enter his third full season of Formula 1 in 2021 racing for the Williams Formula 1 Team.

kn45a9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-6ujc39b2f53a.name: Nicholas Latifi
kn45a9a1-17e6-543l-13k5-6ujc39b2f53a.description: The Canadian goes into the 2021 season needing to up his game to compete with teammate George Russell after being steadily outclassed by his partner and failing to score a point with Williams.
